segment.source: Installing the WDK 8.1 Build Environment in a Lab
segment.target: Installing the WDK 8.1 Build Environment in a Lab

segment.source: The Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 provides a feature that enables you to copy components of Visual Studio and the WDK to a new location and then launch the build environment from the command line.
segment.target: The Windows Driver Kit (WDK) 8.1 provides a feature that enables you to copy components of Visual Studio and the WDK to a new location and then launch the build environment from the command line.

segment.source: From here you can build Windows drivers without having to run the Visual Studio or WDK installation programs.
segment.target: From here you can build Windows drivers without having to run the Visual Studio or WDK installation programs.

segment.source: You might find this feature useful if you need to integrate the WDK with your build process, or if you want to distribute the build process in a lab or test environment.
segment.target: You might find this feature useful if you need to integrate the WDK with your build process, or if you want to distribute the build process in a lab or test environment.

segment.source: Note You can only use this feature for building drivers and applications that use C and C++.
segment.target: Note You can only use this feature for building drivers and applications that use C and C++.

segment.source: This feature cannot be used for managed code or Windows Store apps.
segment.target: This feature cannot be used for managed code or Windows Store apps.

segment.source: Download the Visual Studio and WDK and SDK setup files
segment.target: Download the Visual Studio and WDK and SDK setup files

segment.source: To run the set up script that enables this feature, you need to provide the paths to the Visual Studio and WDK setup files.
segment.target: To run the set up script that enables this feature, you need to provide the paths to the Visual Studio and WDK setup files.

segment.source: Be sure to save these files (rather than install them).
segment.target: Be sure to save these files (rather than install them).

segment.source: Download Visual Studio Professional 2013 or Visual Studio Ultimate 2013.
segment.target: Download Visual Studio Professional 2013 or Visual Studio Ultimate 2013.

segment.source: Download the Product Layout (for example, vs\_ultimate\_download.exe ).
segment.target: Download the Product Layout (for example, vs\_ultimate\_download.exe ).

segment.source: When you are asked if you want to run or save vs\_ultimate\_download.exe, click Run and then select the download option and specify the download path as C:\\VSSetup (this makes the later steps easier).
segment.target: When you are asked if you want to run or save vs\_ultimate\_download.exe, click Run and then select the download option and specify the download path as C:\\VSSetup (this makes the later steps easier).

segment.source: Click Download to download and install a local copy of the DVD layout on the computer.
segment.target: Click Download to download and install a local copy of the DVD layout on the computer.

segment.source: Download the standalone SDK.
segment.target: Download the standalone SDK.

segment.source: When you are asked if you want to run or save sdksetup.exe, click Run and then specify the download location as C:\\Kits\\SDK.
segment.target: When you are asked if you want to run or save sdksetup.exe, click Run and then specify the download location as C:\\Kits\\SDK.

segment.source: Click Next and follow the instructions to download the standalone SDK.
segment.target: Click Next and follow the instructions to download the standalone SDK.

segment.source: Download the WDK 8.1.
segment.target: Download the WDK 8.1.

segment.source: When you are asked if you want to run or save wdksetup.exe, click Run and then specify the download location as C:\\Kits\\WDK.
segment.target: When you are asked if you want to run or save wdksetup.exe, click Run and then specify the download location as C:\\Kits\\WDK.

segment.source: Click Next and follow the instructions to download the WDK.
segment.target: Click Next and follow the instructions to download the WDK.

segment.source: If you have already installed the WDK on the computer, the web installation program will tell you that the features installed on the computer are up-to-date.
segment.target: If you have already installed the WDK on the computer, the web installation program will tell you that the features installed on the computer are up-to-date.

segment.source: To download the WDK setup files so that you can deploy the build environment, click Next and specify the C:\\Kits\\WDK path.
segment.target: To download the WDK setup files so that you can deploy the build environment, click Next and specify the C:\\Kits\\WDK path.

segment.source: 2. Download the BuildLabSupport files
segment.target: 2. Download the BuildLabSupport files

segment.source: To be able install the WDK build environment on computers in a lab, you need to first download the build lab support files on your computer.
segment.target: To be able install the WDK build environment on computers in a lab, you need to first download the build lab support files on your computer.

segment.source: Download BuildLabSupportfiles.zip.
segment.target: Download BuildLabSupportfiles.zip.

segment.source: Extract the contents of the compressed file to your computer.
segment.target: Extract the contents of the compressed file to your computer.

segment.source: The extracted files include the BuildLabSupport directory and include the setup files and utilities you need.
segment.target: The extracted files include the BuildLabSupport directory and include the setup files and utilities you need.

segment.source: 3. Install the WDK 8.1 build environment
segment.target: 3. Install the WDK 8.1 build environment

segment.source: The build lab support files include the setup.ps1 PowerShell command file, which extracts the needed Visual Studio and WDK components and copies them to a target directory (folder).
segment.target: The build lab support files include the setup.ps1 PowerShell command file, which extracts the needed Visual Studio and WDK components and copies them to a target directory (folder).

segment.source: You can then copy this directory to another location, from which you can build projects in a Visual Studio command-line interface (CLI) development environment.
segment.target: You can then copy this directory to another location, from which you can build projects in a Visual Studio command-line interface (CLI) development environment.

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt window with elevated privileges (Run as administrator) and go to the directory where you extracted build lab support files.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt window with elevated privileges (Run as administrator) and go to the directory where you extracted build lab support files.

segment.source: The PowerShell command script setup.ps1 is in the root\\BuildLabSupport directory.
segment.target: The PowerShell command script setup.ps1 is in the root\\BuildLabSupport directory.

segment.source: The syntax for the PowerShell command is as follows:
segment.target: The syntax for the PowerShell command is as follows:

segment.source: PowerShell
segment.target: PowerShell

segment.source: The VSInstallerFilePath is the path to the Visual Studio installation program (for example, Vs\_ultimate.exe) and directory that contains the product layout.
segment.target: The VSInstallerFilePath is the path to the Visual Studio installation program (for example, Vs\_ultimate.exe) and directory that contains the product layout.

segment.source: The KitInstallersPath is the path to the WDK and SDK setup files.
segment.target: The KitInstallersPath is the path to the WDK and SDK setup files.

segment.source: The Target Directory is the target directory for the extracted content.
segment.target: The Target Directory is the target directory for the extracted content.

segment.source: The LogFilePath is the target destination for the log file.
segment.target: The LogFilePath is the target destination for the log file.

segment.source: Filename.xml is the name of the CatalogFile, which contains a list of Microsoft Windows installation files (MSI) to expand as part of the installation.
segment.target: Filename.xml is the name of the CatalogFile, which contains a list of Microsoft Windows installation files (MSI) to expand as part of the installation.

segment.source: The name of the file is files.xml.
segment.target: The name of the file is files.xml.

segment.source: For example, the following command runs the script from BuildLabSupport directory and installs the build environment in C:\\BuildLabInstall directory.
segment.target: For example, the following command runs the script from BuildLabSupport directory and installs the build environment in C:\\BuildLabInstall directory.

segment.source: 4. Build Windows driver projects and solutions
segment.target: 4. Build Windows driver projects and solutions

segment.source: Using the build environment command script
segment.target: Using the build environment command script

segment.source: Open a Command Prompt window.
segment.target: Open a Command Prompt window.

segment.source: Locate the LaunchBuildEnv.cmd file located in the target directory (for example, C:\\BuildLabInstall).
segment.target: Locate the LaunchBuildEnv.cmd file located in the target directory (for example, C:\\BuildLabInstall).

segment.source: Launch the build environment by running LaunchBuildEnv.cmd.
segment.target: Launch the build environment by running LaunchBuildEnv.cmd.

segment.source: Use MSBuild commands to build your driver projects and solutions.
segment.target: Use MSBuild commands to build your driver projects and solutions.

segment.target: For example:
